title: Design Strategies for Reusable Learning Objects (RLOs) in Blended Engineering Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of college-level foundational engineering mathematics (calculus, linear algebra)
context.additional_context: A corporate re-education program structured around a practice-oriented learning environment centered on solving on-site problems.

learning_goals: Learners can solve over 80% of engineering mathematics problems (partial differential equations, matrix operations) via simulation using RLOs.
Perform 3D spatial coordinate system transformation problems in a VR environment with a 90%+ success rate for three consecutive attempts.
In a blended learning environment, revise and apply learning strategies at least twice based on peer feedback and formative assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
